meanings.definition: Supervised or monitored, especially during an examination.
meanings.sent1: The proctored exam required a teacher to watch the students closely.
meanings.sent2: The students felt secure knowing the exam was proctored by a responsible adult.
meanings.sent3: During the proctored test, the students tried to sneak glances at their notes without getting caught.
meanings.sent4: The proctored environment created a sense of accountability among the test-takers.
meanings.sent5: The proctored exam felt like a protective shield against cheating.

meanings.definition: To oversee or invigilate an exam or test.
meanings.sent1: The teacher proctored the exam to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent2: She will proctor the final exam next week.
meanings.sent3: The principal proctored the test with a smile, making the students less nervous.
meanings.sent4: He proctored the exam with a keen eye for any signs of cheating.
meanings.sent5: Proctoring the exam required a lot of attention and focus.
